results.abstract: Peter Wood article on CBS filming of Amer Bicentennial Mt Everest Expedition; CBS programming vp Barry Frank comments; illus (M)

headline.main: A Climb to the Top of the World In Search of High Ratings; A Climb for Higher Ratings

results.snippet: Late last spring, Barry Frank, the CBS vice president in charge of sports programming, stuck his neck out. Acting on what amounted to a hunch, he  committed a large portion of his department's annual budget to sending a film crew to Nepal for more...
results.lead_paragraph: Late last spring, Barry Frank, the CBS vice president in charge of sports programming, stuck his neck out. Acting on what amounted to a hunch, he committed a large portion of his department's annual budget to sending a film crew to Nepal for more than two months to cover the American Bicentennial Mount Everest Expedition.

results.abstract: 85 freshmen Congressmen are sworn in as 95th Cong convenes; 18 new Sens and 67 new Reprs are joined by family and friends as they take oath; some new legislators comment; illus of new Repr John J Cavanaugh and his son; illus of new Repr Barbara Mikulski and guests (M)

headline.main: 85 Freshman Legislators Find Their Thrill on Capitol Hill; 85 Freshman Legislators Take Oath of Office and Find Their Thrill on Capitol Hill

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Jan. 4 With their young children running through the aisles and their spouses and parents beaming from the galleries, members of the 95th Congress took the oath of office today.

results.abstract: Army Sec Hoffmann says cadets implicated in '76 cheating scandal will be permitted to return in summer '77; rejects recommendation of Borman Comm that cadets be allowed to return 'as soon as possible'; also rejects recommendation to halt remaining 12 cheating investigations and permit cadets whose separation had not taken place to remain on post (M)

headline.main: Army to Let Ousted Cadets Return, But Not Under Borman's Formula

results.snippet: WEST POINT, N.Y., Jan. 5 West Point cadets ousted in last year's cheating scandal will be permitted to return, but not until this summer, Army Secretary Martin R. Hoffmann said today, thereby rejecting the major recommendation of the Borman...

byline.original: By JAMES FERON Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WEST POINT, N.Y., Jan. 5 West Point cadets ousted in last year's cheating scandal will be permitted to return, but not until this summer, Army Secretary Martin R. Hoffmann said today, thereby rejecting the major recommendation of the Borman Commission that the cadets be readmitted "as soon as possible."

results.snippet: The big man loomed over the agent's desk: blond, broad-shouldered, the huge "S" on his chest as unmistakable a trademark as the cape around his shoulders.

results.abstract: Article on mental depression among Amers; symptoms and treatment discussed; drawing (M)
results.snippet: THE FEELING is familiar to most everyone nothing seems satisfying, things don't work out,  much of anything and your mental landscape is bleak. It's called depression, and few of us get through life without experiencing it at one time or another.
results.lead_paragraph: THE FEELING is familiar to most everyone nothing seems satisfying, things don't work out, much of anything and your mental landscape is bleak. It's called depression, and few of us get through life without experiencing it at one time or another.
